types.name: Network
types.description: {"en":"The network object.","ru":"Объект сети."}

fields.name: id
fields.description: {"en":"The network ID.","ru":"ID сети."}

fields.name: network
fields.description: {"en":"The network range.","ru":"Диапазон сети."}

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: {"en":"The latitude of the location associated with the network.","ru":"Широта местоположения, связанного с сетью."}

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: {"en":"The longitude of the location associated with the network.","ru":"Долгота местоположения, связанного с сетью."}

fields.name: accuracyRadius
fields.description: {"en":"The radius in kilometers around the specified location where the IP address is likely to be.","ru":"Радиус в километрах вокруг указанного местоположения, в котором, вероятно, будет находиться IP-адрес."}

fields.name: region
fields.description: {"en":"The region in which the network is located.","ru":"Регион, в котором расположена сеть."}

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Region
types.description: {"en":"The region object.","ru":"Объект региона."}

fields.name: id
fields.description: {"en":"The region ID.","ru":"ID региона."}

fields.name: name
fields.description: {"en":"The name of the region in the specified language.","ru":"Название региона на указанном языке."}

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: {"en":"The latitude of the region location.","ru":"Широта местоположения региона."}

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: {"en":"The longitude of the region location.","ru":"Долгота местоположения региона."}

fields.name: type
fields.description: {"en":"The type of the region. Possible values: continent, country, division1, division2, division3, division4, city.","ru":"Тип региона. Возможные значения: continent, country, division1, division2, division3, division4, city."}

fields.name: continentCode
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the continent. Possible values: AF (Africa), AS (Asia), EU (Europe), NA (North America), SA (South America), OC (Oceania), AN (Antarctica).","ru":"Код континента. Возможные значения: AF (Африка), AS (Азия), EU (Европа), NA (Северная Америка), SA (Южная Америка), OC (Океания), AN (Антарктида)."}

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the country (ISO-639-1).","ru":"Код страны (ISO-639-1)."}

fields.name: division1Code
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the first-order country division.","ru":"Код подразделения страны первого порядка."}

fields.name: division2Code
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the second-order country division.","ru":"Код подразделения страны второго порядка."}

fields.name: division3Code
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the third-order country division.","ru":"Код подразделения страны третьего порядка."}

fields.name: division4Code
fields.description: {"en":"The code of the fourth-order country division.","ru":"Код подразделения страны четвертого порядка."}

fields.name: population
fields.description: {"en":"The population of the region.","ru":"Население региона."}

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: {"en":"The time zone of the region.","ru":"Часовой пояс региона."}

fields.name: parentRegions
fields.description: {"en":"Parent regions that the region belongs to.","ru":"Родительские регионы, к которым относится регион."}

types.description: {"en":"The parent region.","ru":"Родительский регион."}

fields.name: name

fields.name: deletedAt

types.name: Long
types.description: The `Long` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Long can represent values between -(2^53 - 1) and 2^53 - 1.

fields.description: {"en":"The date the object was created.","ru":"Дата создания объекта."}

fields.description: {"en":"Determines whether the request is authorized.","ru":"Определяет, является ли запрос авторизованным."}

fields.name: region
fields.description: {"en":"Returns the region by ID.","ru":"Возвращает регион по ID."}

args.name: id
args.description: {"en":"The region ID.","ru":"ID региона."}

fields.name: continents
fields.description: {"en":"Returns a list of all continents.","ru":"Возвращает список всех континентов."}

fields.name: regions
fields.description: {"en":"Returns a list of regions.","ru":"Возвращает список регионов."}

args.name: first
args.description: {"en":"The number of items on the page. Used for forward pagination.","ru":"Количество элементов на странице. Используется для навигации вперед."}

args.name: after
args.description: {"en":"The cursor of the item relative to which the next items should be returned. Used for forward pagination.","ru":"Курсор элемента, относительно которого должны быть возвращены следующие элементы. Используется для навигации вперед."}

args.name: last
args.description: {"en":"The number of items on the page. Used for backward pagination.","ru":"Количество элементов на странице. Используется для навигации назад."}

args.name: before
args.description: {"en":"The cursor of the item relative to which the previous items should be returned. Used for backward pagination.","ru":"Курсор элемента, относительно которого должны быть возвращены предыдущие элементы. Используется для навигации назад."}

types.description: {"en":"The object that stores the status of the operation.","ru":"Объект, в котором хранится статус операции."}

fields.name: ok
fields.description: {"en":"Whether the operation was completed successfully.","ru":"Была ли операция завершена успешно."}

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: RegionConnection
types.description: {"en":"A type that provides a standard mechanism for paginating the result set.","ru":"Тип, обеспечивающий стандартный механизм разбиения набора результатов на страницы."}

fields.name: edges
fields.description: {"en":"Item list.","ru":"Список элементов."}

fields.description: {"en":"Information about the current page.","ru":"Информация о текущей странице."}

types.description: {"en":"A list item.","ru":"Элемент списка."}

fields.name: node
fields.description: {"en":"An object.","ru":"Объект."}

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: {"en":"A cursor that is used to get the next page.","ru":"Курсор, который используется для получения следующей страницы."}

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: {"en":"Information about the current page.","ru":"Информация о текущей странице."}

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: {"en":"Indicates whether the list items exist on the next page. Used to navigate forward.","ru":"Показывает, существуют ли элементы списка на следующей странице. Используется для навигации вперед."}

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: {"en":"Indicates whether the list items exist on the previous page. Used to navigate backwards.","ru":"Существуют ли элементы списка на предыдущей странице. Используется для навигации назад."}

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: {"en":"Indicates whether the list items exist on the previous page. Used to navigate forward.","ru":"Существуют ли элементы списка на предыдущей странице. Используется для навигации вперед."}

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: {"en":"Indicates whether the list items exist on the previous page. Used to navigate backwards.","ru":"Существуют ли элементы списка на предыдущей странице. Используется для навигации назад."}

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.
